docs.title: Kassahi's PD2 Loot Filter
docs.text:
Work in progress

This loot filter is in a constant state of development.

Currently supports Season 9.

Welcome to Kassahi's PD2 loot filter. This loot filter is designed to help you quickly identify valuable items and hide items that are not worth picking up. The filter is designed to be easy to read and understand, with clear visual cues to help you quickly identify items.

On the left hand side of the page (hamburger menu if no sidebar) you will find a list of topics that dive deeper into the levels and examples.

Helpful external links:

  • PD2 Wiki - Loot Filters
  • FilterBird - PD2 Loot Filter Editor

docs.title: LoD style
docs.text:
All items will always show the LoD style of colors on items (except high runes, DClone, and Rathma items in Hyper versions).

All white, gray, magic, rare, and crafted items have the real base name.

docs.title: Magic Charms
docs.text: Magic Large & Grand Charms have additional info for what type they are.

docs.title: Crafted items
docs.text: Crafted items also have the type of craft in the names.

docs.title: Unique Charms and Jewels
docs.text: Unique Charms and Jewels are also the same. Hellfire Torchs and Rainbow Facets have additional info for what type they are.

docs.title: Magic and rare items
docs.text: Magic and rare items have a little dark green * (star) to show what items is identified.

docs.title: Superior items (0 ED, infinite, ethereal, socketed)
Corrupted (slammed) items
docs.text:
Shows corrupted (slammed) tag in names.

Note

The red * (star) on the right side of the number of sockets. This is from the corruption.

docs.title: Rejuvenation Potions
docs.text:
+35% Rejuvenation Potions hidden on filter levels 3-9

+65% Rejuvenation Potions always shown

docs.title: Health and Mana Potions
docs.text:
• Health and Mana potion 1 hidden after level 7
  • Health and Mana potion 2 hidden after level 15
  • Health and Mana potion 3 hidden after level 19
  • Health and Mana potion 4 hidden after level 59
  • Health and Mana potion 5+ hidden on filter levels 3-9

docs.title: Antidotes, Thawing, and Stamina Potions; TP and ID scrolls
docs.text:
• Antidotes hidden on filter levels 6-9
    • Antidotes are still shown when doing (high poison damage areas):
      • Rathma
      • Ruins of Viz-Jun
      • Ancestral Trial
      • Kehjistan Marketplace
      • Tomb of Zoltun Kulle
      • Lost Temple
  • Stamina potions hidden after level 19
  • Thawing potions and TP scrolls hidden on filter levels 3-9
  • ID scrolls hidden after level 74

docs.title: Keys
docs.text:
Keys in shop show the chat commands

Keys on ground hidden after level 29

docs.title: Throwables
docs.text:
• Throwing potions 1 hidden after level 10
  • Throwing potions 2 hidden after level 20
  • Throwing potions 3 hidden after level 40

docs.title: Gems
docs.text:
• Chipped, flawed, and normal gems hidden after level 23
  • Flawless and perfect gems are always shown
    • Flawless gems can be hidden with filter level 9
  • Perfect gems have notifications
  • F- for Flawless, includes colored O
  • P- for Perfect, includes colored O and orange colored name
  • The orange # is used to highligh which ones are most used in crafting for the playing class
  • The gray # is used to highlight which ones are most used in crafting for other classes

Gems also have good miscellaneus information

docs.title: Runes
docs.text:
• Runes are always shown
  • Includes the rune number, quantity, then # for crafting (orange for playing class, gray for other classes; same as gems)

Runes also have good miscellaneus information

docs.title: Mini Uber Keys, Organs, and similar items
Infusion crafting materials
docs.text: Similar to gems and runes, infusion crafting materials have the same type of idea as gems and runes (O's and #)

docs.title: Maps
docs.text:
• Show immunities
  • Show highest resistance
  • Show density
  • Show negative and positive modifiers
  • Show warnings if a type of map always has the same bad monsters

Color legend:

  • Density: Teal
  • Negative Modifiers: Orange
  • Positive: Green
  • Warnings: Red

docs.title: Crafting
docs.text:
Rings and amulets have C: xx+ in the names (C = Crafting), meaning it's the minimum character level needed in order to get some like 2+ to skills and 20 FCR

Magic and rare items also have the outcome of the craft in the description

To see the alvl (crafted ilvl) before it's crafted with the character you're using, if the number is orange you're good to go, if white you need a higher clvl (character level) or a higher ilvl (item level) from the item itself

docs.title: Runeword bases
docs.text:
Show for both leveling and end game.

  • Leveling is orange and only shown on filter level 1
  • End game is green and is on all filter levels

docs.title: General
docs.text:
• Up: Upgrading an item to the next tier
  • Weapons: More damage
  • Armors: More defense usually
  • Green numbers: What runes are needed
  • O: What gem is needed, plus color
  • Dark Green S:/D:/L: How much Strength, Dexterity, and/or levels required
  • Max OS: Maximum open sockets
    • Teal Q: Laruzk's Socket Quest
    • Gold LB: Larzuk's Puzzlebox or Puzzlepiece for magic, rare, and crafted items
    • Red C: Worldstone Shard
    • Orange C: Upgrade item two times in order to get additional sockets with Worldstone Shards
  • Rolls OS: Rolls Open Sockets
  • Base: Base of weapon
  • Sp: Weapon attack speed
  • R: Weapon range

docs.title: Auras
docs.text:
• Aura: Information about the weapon's aura. Example, Infinity:
    • None: How much negative resistence the monsters get from Infinity if a monster isn't immune
    • Immus: How much negative resistence the monsters get from Infinity if a monster is immune
    • This way makes it easier to know what Infinity (and other items with Amp, LRE, etc) can or can't break

Note

As you can see in the picture, it also says (Cya: Absord Ele Dmg:###). That's for the (+3 to Cyclone Armor not buffed from energy). There are many more cases like this on other items as well.

docs.title: Half Freeze Duration and Cannot Be Fronzen
docs.text:
• Inventory And Stash = 2x HFD = CBF
  • 1 = Gray, 2 = Green, 3+ = Red
  • If you already have CBF on it'll let you know

docs.title: Gold information
docs.text: Most items have this information.

docs.title: Set items
docs.text:
• Set items will show their set bonuses
    • 2:, 3:, 4:, etc, is how many pieces are needed
    • Full: is full set
    • Set boots also have kick damage info

docs.title: Gamble vendors
docs.text: Shows possible uniques and sets.

docs.title: Mirroring and GG items
docs.text:
Mirror items have purple, white, orange, white, purple colors

Good and 5+ to skills items have orange, red, green, red, orange colors

docs.title: Jewels
docs.text: Rare jewels rerolling info: shows the ilvl before its rerolled

docs.title: Filter levels
docs.text: The filter levels are used to determine the level of filtering that is applied to the loot filter. The filter levels are below.

docs.title: Filter Lvl 1: Starter Filter Lvl (S9)
docs.text:
• Shows Tp scrolls, 35% Juvs, Thaw
  • Shows Lvling (Highlights/RWs), Under 10 Ed (Eth Not Included)
  • Shows Notifier on Magic Amulets, Magic Arrows/a Bunch of Melee Weapon & Exceptional Armors
  • Hides 50 Gold & Below
  • Hides 500 Gold & Below After Level 17
  • Hides 5k Gold & Below After Level 79

docs.title: Shows Highlighted Orange * (star) on Related Magic & Rare Class Items
Filter Lvl 2: S: H5/M5. Small Strictness
docs.text: • Hides/Removes All The Stuff From Filter Lvl 1

docs.title: Filter Lvl 3: S: H5/M5. Medium Strictness
docs.text:
• Hides Unrelated Magic & Rare Class Items
  • Hides Magic Rings & Amulets
  • Hides +3 Skill Bases

docs.title: Filter Lvl 4: S: H5/M5. Large Strictness
docs.text:
• Hides Flawless Gems
  • Hides Non-Highlighted Uniques & Sets
  • Hides Non-Highlighted LLD Items

docs.title: Filter Lvl 5: S: H5/M5. Extra Strictness
docs.text:
• Hides Uniques & Sets With Gray x in The Name
  • Hides Global Magic & Rare Crafting Bases
  • Hides Related Magic & Rare Class Items
  • Hides All Magic Circlets
  • Hides Many Magic & Rare Items
  • Hides Bases With 10+ ED (Non-Ethereal)
  • Hides Notifications For Runes Less Than Lem
  • Hides Notifications For Magic Charms & Jewels

docs.title: Filter Lvl 6: S: Juice. Small Strictness
docs.text: • Hides/Removes H5 & M5, Plus All The Stuff From Filter Lvl 1

docs.title: Filter Lvl 7: S: Juice. Medium Strictness
docs.text:
• Hides Unrelated Magic & Rare Class Items
  • Hides Magic Rings & Amulets
  • Hides +3 Skill Bases

docs.title: Filter Lvl 8: S: Juice. Large Strictness
docs.text:
• Hides Flawless Gems
  • Hides Non-Highlighted Uniques & Sets
  • Hides Non-Highlighted LLD Items

docs.title: Filter Lvl 9: S: Juice. Extra Strictness
docs.text:
• Hides Uniques & Sets With Gray x in The Name
  • Hides Global Magic & Rare Crafting Bases
  • Hides Related Magic & Rare Class Items
  • Hides All Magic Circlets
  • Hides Many Magic & Rare Items
  • Hides Bases With 10+ ED (Non-Ethereal)
  • Hides Notifications For Runes Less Than Lem
  • Hides Notifications For Magic Charms & Jewels

docs.title: Types of filters
docs.text:
There are three main categories:

  • Crafters: This was used for crafting season. It's now outdated.
  • Regular: These are the filters that are used for regular seasons. Most up-to-date.
  • Meme: Based off regular, but will have suprising names :)

docs.title: Hyper and Non-Hyper filters
docs.text:
Hyper filters are more dramatic and have more stylized look, whereas Non-Hyper filters are more subtle.

HyperNon-Hyper
